author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: UC Irvine Tops South Dakota State 64-52 in Cancun Challenge
text:
UC Irvine Tops South Dakota State 64-52 in Cancun Challenge
UC Irvine secured a 64-52 win over South Dakota State, finishing the Cancun Challenge with five players scoring in double figures. Guard Jurian Dixon led the Anteaters with 13 points, while Andre Henry contributed a season-high 11 points. Kyle Evans achieved a double-double with 10 points and 10 rebounds, earning Player of the Game honors. UCI improved its record to 4-4, showing enhanced ball movement and offensive efficiency compared to previous games.
- UC Irvine shot 38.8% from the floor and 75.0% from the free-throw line (21-28).
- UCI out-rebounded SDSU 42-33 in the match.
- UCI leveled its season record at 4-4 following this victory.
- The Anteaters showcased improved offensive strategies, notably in their passing and shot selection.
UC Irvine aims to maintain momentum as they prepare to face San Jose State on November 30, seeking to extend their winning streak.
Bottom LineUCI's solid performance underscores their resilience and potential for improvement as the season progresses, positioning them favorably for upcoming challenges.
Read more at UCI Athletics
